findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract pauser has the authority to pause the transactions for all users. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `pause` function.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The master minter has the authority to give permission to minters to mint an allowed mint amount, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract's blacklister has the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklist` function.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: TCD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract rescuer has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `rescueERC20` function.

findings.title: DKO - Delete Keyword Optimization
findings.description: The contract resets variables to the default state by setting the initial values, which increases gas cost.

findings.title: RDS - Redundant Data Structure
findings.description: The contract uses two data structures: one to determine if a user is a minter and another to point to the allowed mint amount. Since the minter has an amount greater than zero, then he is a minter. Hence, the `minters` data structure is redundant.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
